title: BLB bootstrapping
text: Compare metrics  Compare ranks  Compare diff
code: results_standard <- pgsmetrics(   df,   pgs = paste0("pgs", 1:10),   dep = "y_bin",   covars = c("age"),   n_boot = 100,   n_cores = 4 ) #> Binary outcome variable detected #> bootstrapping (standard)... #> processing resamples... #> computing observed values... #> computing differences...  results_blb <- pgsmetrics(   boot_method = "blb",   data = df,   pgs = paste0("pgs", 1:10),   dep = "y_bin",   covars = c("age"),   n_cores = 4 ) #> Binary outcome variable detected #> bootstrapping (blb)... #> processing resamples... library(ggplot2)  met <- "metrics" comp1 <- results_standard[[met]] comp2 <- results_blb[[met]] comp1$boot_method <- "standard" comp2$boot_method <- "blb" comp <- rbindlist(list(comp1, comp2)) ggplot(   comp[type == "partial", ],   aes(y = pgs, x = observed, xmin = ci_lower, xmax = ci_upper, color = boot_method) ) +   geom_pointrange(size = 1 / 5, position = position_dodge(width = 1 / 2)) +   facet_wrap(~metric, scales = "free_x", ncol = 5) +   theme_classic() met <- "ranks" comp1 <- results_standard[[met]] comp2 <- results_blb[[met]] comp1$boot_method <- "standard" comp2$boot_method <- "blb" comp <- rbindlist(list(comp1, comp2)) ggplot(   comp[type == "partial", ],   aes(y = pgs, x = observed, xmin = ci_lower, xmax = ci_upper, color = boot_method) ) +   geom_pointrange(size = 1 / 5, position = position_dodge(width = 1 / 2)) +   facet_wrap(~metric, scales = "free_x", ncol = 5) +   theme_classic() comp1 <- results_standard$diff comp2 <- results_blb$diff comp1$boot_method <- "standard" comp2$boot_method <- "blb" comp <- rbindlist(list(comp1, comp2)) ggplot(   comp,   aes(y = pgs1_pgs2, x = observed, xmin = ci_lower, xmax = ci_upper, color = boot_method) ) +   geom_pointrange(size = 1 / 5, position = position_dodge(width = 1 / 2)) +   facet_wrap(~metric, scales = "free_x", ncol = 5) +   theme_classic()

title: BLB bootstrapping
text: Compare metrics  Compare ranks  Compare diff
code: results_standard <- pgsmetrics(   df,   pgs = paste0("pgs", 1:10),   dep = "y",   covars = c("age"),   n_boot = 100,   n_cores = 4 ) #> Continuous outcome variable detected #> bootstrapping (standard)... #> processing resamples... #> computing observed values... #> computing differences...  results_blb <- pgsmetrics(   boot_method = "blb",   data = df,   pgs = paste0("pgs", 1:10),   dep = "y",   covars = c("age"),   n_cores = 4 ) #> Continuous outcome variable detected #> bootstrapping (blb)... #> processing resamples... library(ggplot2)  met <- "metrics" comp1 <- results_standard[[met]] comp2 <- results_blb[[met]] comp1$boot_method <- "standard" comp2$boot_method <- "blb" comp <- rbindlist(list(comp1, comp2)) ggplot(   comp[type == "partial", ],   aes(y = pgs, x = observed, xmin = ci_lower, xmax = ci_upper, color = boot_method) ) +   geom_pointrange(size = 1 / 5, position = position_dodge(width = 1 / 2)) +   facet_wrap(~metric, scales = "free_x", ncol = 5) +   theme_classic() met <- "ranks" comp1 <- results_standard[[met]] comp2 <- results_blb[[met]] comp1$boot_method <- "standard" comp2$boot_method <- "blb" comp <- rbindlist(list(comp1, comp2)) ggplot(   comp[type == "partial", ],   aes(y = pgs, x = observed, xmin = ci_lower, xmax = ci_upper, color = boot_method) ) +   geom_pointrange(size = 1 / 5, position = position_dodge(width = 1 / 2)) +   facet_wrap(~metric, scales = "free_x", ncol = 5) +   theme_classic() comp1 <- results_standard$diff comp2 <- results_blb$diff comp1$boot_method <- "standard" comp2$boot_method <- "blb" comp <- rbindlist(list(comp1, comp2)) ggplot(   comp,   aes(y = pgs1_pgs2, x = observed, xmin = ci_lower, xmax = ci_upper, color = boot_method) ) +   geom_pointrange(size = 1 / 5, position = position_dodge(width = 1 / 2)) +   facet_wrap(~metric, scales = "free_x", ncol = 5) +   theme_classic()

title: Getting Started with pgsmetrics
text: First, let’s simulate data: Now, let’s use pgsmetrics function fit models different PGS compute performance metrics. example, ’ll use 5 PGS varying degree measurement error (TODO see PGS simulation vignette). assume binary variable (y_bin), adjust age, use 100 bootstrap replicates (TODO >200>200 >500>500 recommended). metrics stored results$metrics. three different values PGS metric, one covariate-model (PGS, cov), one full model (full), one difference full cov (incremental value, full - cov). Let’s plot metrics  bootstrap replication, rank PGS based metrics compute confidence intervals. Let’s plot ranks.  Diff
code: n_simul <- 1e4 df <- simulate_data(n = n_simul, n_pgs = 5) results <- pgsmetrics(   df,   pgs = paste0("pgs", 1:5),   dep = "y_bin",   covars = c("age"),   n_boot = 100,   n_cores = 4 ) #> Binary outcome variable detected #> bootstrapping (standard)... #> processing resamples... #> computing observed values... #> computing differences... print(results, n = 1) #> Dependent variable: y_bin  #> Covariates: age  #> Bootstrap method: standard  #> Bootstrap iterations: 100  #> Results ($metrics): #>        pgs  metric    type   observed     ci_lower     ci_upper #>     <fctr>  <char>  <fctr>      <num>        <num>        <num> #>  1:   pgs1     aic     cov 9738.05498 9551.3446797 9.921613e+03 #> ---                                                             #> 75:   pgs5 roc_auc partial    0.02631    0.0214058 3.214482e-02 #> Other results for ranks/differences are available under $ranks/$diff plot(results, model_type = "partial", ncol = 5) plot(results, type = "ranks", ncol = 5) plot(results, type = "diff", ncol = 5)

title: Getting Started with pgsmetrics
text: metrics stored results_quant$metrics Let’s plot metrics  Let’s plot ranks  Diff
code: results_quant <- pgsmetrics(   df,   pgs = paste0("pgs", 1:5),   dep = "y",   covars = c("age"),   n_boot = 100,   n_cores = 4 ) #> Continuous outcome variable detected #> bootstrapping (standard)... #> processing resamples... #> computing observed values... #> computing differences... print(results_quant, n = 1) #> Dependent variable: y  #> Covariates: age  #> Bootstrap method: standard  #> Bootstrap iterations: 100  #> Results ($metrics): #>        pgs metric    type    observed     ci_lower     ci_upper #>     <fctr> <char>  <fctr>       <num>        <num>        <num> #>  1:   pgs1    aic     cov 25558.24975 2.530017e+04 2.578349e+04 #> ---                                                             #> 60:   pgs5     r2 partial     0.06127 5.204217e-02 7.017316e-02 #> Other results for ranks/differences are available under $ranks/$diff plot(results_quant, ncol = 5) plot(results_quant, type = "ranks", ncol = 5) plot(results_quant, type = "diff", ncol = 4)

title: Getting Started with pgsmetrics
code: p_cal1 <- plot_calibration(df, pgs = "pgs1", dep = "y_bin") p_cal2 <- plot_calibration(df, pgs = "pgs1", dep = "y_bin", covars = c("age", "sex")) cowplot::plot_grid(p_cal1, p_cal2, nrow = 1)

title: Getting Started with pgsmetrics
code: p_dcurve1 <- plot_dcurve(df, pgs = "pgs1", dep = "y_bin") p_dcurve2 <- plot_dcurve(df, pgs = "pgs1", dep = "y_bin", covars = c("age", "sex")) cowplot::plot_grid(p_dcurve1, p_dcurve2, nrow = 1)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Norland K (2025). pgsmetrics: Functions Compute Metrics Polygenic Risk Scores Compare . R package version 0.0.9.
code: @Manual{,   title = {pgsmetrics: Functions To Compute Metrics for Polygenic Risk Scores and Compare Them},   author = {Kristjan Norland},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.9}, }

what: Functions To Compute Metrics for Polygenic Risk Scores and Compare Them
title: Functions To Compute Metrics for Polygenic Risk Scores and Compare Them
text: pgsmetrics makes easy compute metrics polygenic scores bootstrap uncertainty intervals. metrics : Nagelkerke’s R2R^2 (binary) Liability scale R2R^2 (binary) Brier score (binary) R2R^2 (continuous) MSE (continuous) MAE (continuous) AIC ROC AUC (binary) plot_calibration Net benefit, decision curve plot (plot_dcurve) (also possible add custom metrics → see Metric R6 class.) possible use alternative bootstrap method, Bag Little Bootstraps (BLB, boot_type = "blb"), useful number samples PGS large (f.x., 500K samples 50 PGS). TODO link : Get started vignette…

title: Functions To Compute Metrics for Polygenic Risk Scores and Compare Them

what: Compare Polygenic Scores (PGS) using bootstrapping — pgsmetrics
title: Compare Polygenic Scores (PGS) using bootstrapping — pgsmetrics
text: function compares Polygenic Scores (PGS) bootstrapping difference using various metrics. supports single PGS evaluation, pairwise comparisons, ranking multiple PGS.

title: Compare Polygenic Scores (PGS) using bootstrapping — pgsmetrics
code: pgsmetrics(   data,   pgs,   dep,   covars = NULL,   K = NULL,   boot = TRUE,   boot_method = "standard",   blb_s = 10,   blb_r = 50,   blb_b = 0.9,   n_boot = 1000,   n_cores = 1,   missing = "warn",   return_boot_stats = FALSE,   custom_metrics_list = NULL )

title: Compare Polygenic Scores (PGS) using bootstrapping — pgsmetrics
text: data data.table containing necessary data: PGS, dependent variable, covariates. pgs Character vector. Metrics computed pgs. Must exist data. dep Character. Name dependent variable data. Binary variable must 0/1 (otherwise continuous assumed). covars Character vector. Names covariate adjust . Must columns data. K Double, 0 1. Prevalence binary trait population. Used $R^2$ liability scale. boot Boolean. Whether perform bootstrap . boot_method Character vector. Either standard blb. standard usual non-parametric bootstrap, blb Bag Little Bootstraps, useful analysis large datasets (f.x., $n>500000$) many PGS. However, BLB standard bootstrap may yield identical results. standard bootstrap uses observed statistics (observations) gives percentile CIs resampling. BLB bootstrap estimates mean across resamples (instead observed value) percentile CIs. blb_s Integer. TODO. Default: 20. blb_r Integer. TODO. Default: 100. blb_b Double 0 1. TODO. Default: 0.8. n_boot Integer. Number bootstrap iterations. Default 1000. n_cores Integer. Number cores parallel processing. Default 1. missing Warns missing values data. Use missing="drop" drop rows missing values. However, recommend imputing missing values instead. Default: "warn". return_boot_stats Return bootstrap output processing (debugging). Default: FALSE.

title: Compare Polygenic Scores (PGS) using bootstrapping — pgsmetrics
text: object class "pgsmetrics" containing: metrics data.table calculated metrics PGS. data.table, type can partial/full/cov, partial=full-cov, full=model covariates+pgs, cov=model covariates. using boot_method="blb", observed column median value metric statistic, using boot_method="standard", value analysis unmodified dataset. boot_output raw output bootstrapping process. call original function call.

title: Compare Polygenic Scores (PGS) using bootstrapping — pgsmetrics
code: # Simulate data data <- simulate_data(n = 1000, n_pgs = 3)  # Single PGS evaluation result_single <- pgsmetrics(data,     pgs = c("pgs1", "pgs2", "pgs3"),     dep = "y_bin",     covars = c("age", "sex"),     n_boot = 100 ) #> Binary outcome variable detected #> bootstrapping (standard)... #> processing resamples... #> computing observed values... #> computing differences... # print(result_single)

what: Plot Calibration Curve with Prediction Intervals — plot_calibration
title: Plot Calibration Curve with Prediction Intervals — plot_calibration
Plot Calibration Curve with Prediction Intervals — plot_calibration
code: plot_calibration(   df,   pgs,   dep,   covars = NULL,   x_lab = "Predicted",   y_lab = "Observed",   conf_level = 0.95,   annotation_size = 3,   annotation_x = 0.05,   annotation_y = 0.85 )

title: Plot Calibration Curve with Prediction Intervals — plot_calibration
text: df data.frame object, must contain pgs dep. pgs PGS include model. dep Outcome variable, must binary. covars Additional covariates include model. Default: NULL. x_lab Text, x-axis. Default: "Predicted". y_lab Text, y-axis. Default: "Observed". conf_level Confidence level prediction interval. Default: 0.95. annotation_size Font size  calibration metric text box. Default: 3. annotation_x x-axis position calibration metric text box. Default: 0.05. annotation_y y-axis position calibration metric text box. Default: 0.85.

title: Plot Calibration Curve with Prediction Intervals — plot_calibration
text: ggplot object following annotated calibration metrics: ICI Integrated calibration index (average absolute difference) E50 Median absolute difference E90 90th percentile absolute difference Emax Maximum absolute difference ECI Estimated calibration index (average square difference)

title: Plot Decision Curve — plot_dcurve
code: plot_dcurve(   df,   pgs,   dep,   covars = NULL,   dca_thresholds = seq(0, 0.5, by = 0.01),   dca_plot_smooth = TRUE )

title: Plot Decision Curve — plot_dcurve
text: df data.frame object, must contain pgs dep. pgs PGS include model. dep Outcome variable, must binary. covars Additional covariates include model. Default: NULL. dca_thresholds Vector threshold probabilities, x-axis ('thresholds' argument dcurves::dca.) dca_plot_smooth Smooth lines? ('smooth' argument dcurves:::plot.dca.)

title: Simulate data for testing — simulate_data
text: function simulates dataset PGS, covariates, dependent variables testing purposes.

title: Simulate data for testing — simulate_data
code: simulate_data(   n = 10000,   seed = NULL,   n_pgs = 5,   pgs_true_her_explained = 0.25,   pgs_her_explained_ub = pgs_true_her_explained/2,   pgs_her_explained_lb = pgs_true_her_explained/4,   age_prop_explained = 0.25,   env_prop_explained = 0.5,   dep_prevalence = 0.25 )

title: Simulate data for testing — simulate_data
text: n number observations simulate. Default: 10000. seed random seed reproducibility. Default: NULL. n_pgs number PGS simulate. Default: 5. pgs_true_her_explained >= 0 <= 0.5. Default: 0.25. pgs_her_explained_ub Lower bound heritability explained PGS. pgs_her_explained_lb Upper bound heritability explained PGS. age_prop_explained proportion y y_bin explained age. Default: 0.25. env_prop_explained proportion y y_bin explained environmental factors. Default: 0.5. dep_prevalence Prevalence binary trait. Default: 0.25.
